properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 9 at 1:26PM CST until February 9 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the Cumberland River...Stones River...

Cumberland River At Nashville affecting Davidson County
Stones River Near Donelson affecting Davidson County

.The Cumberland River and Stones River continue to run high per the
heavy rainfall of last week. The water will fall slowly as dry weather
continues this afternoon and early evening. However, late evening,
overnight, and into the first half of the work week additional
rainfall is expected which could cause additional rises on the
Cumberland River and Stones River.

The Flood Advisory continues for
The Cumberland River At Nashville
* Until this evening.
* At 12PM Sunday the stage was 29.9 feet.
* Action stage is 30.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 40.0 feet.
* The river will rise to near 33.4 feet Wednesday morning.
* At 34.0 feet...Water reaches the second grassy area of the riverfront landing
and covers most of the recreation areas on the east side of the river near
Nissan Stadium.
* At 32.0 feet...Further inundation of low lying areas along the river is
occurring including the riverfront landing and receation areas near Nissan
Stadium.
* At 30.0 feet...Water reaches the first grassy area of the riverfront landing,
and the access point on the east side of the river near Nissan Stadium.
* At 25.0 feet...The riverfront recreation areas on both sides of the river
begin to be inundated.
properties.instruction:
Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further
information from the National Weather Service.
